Atthis crisis, so far asmy human judgement enabled me to do so, having carefully reviewed my whole position, and cast up the account, I have arrived at the net result of all my deliberations3 and to the best of my ability, I shall give you a short exposi- tion of it.

For my part, if Ι saw that the state was in the hands of unscrupulous and abandoned citizens, as we know occurred in the days of Cinna as well as at other times, not only should Ι not be tempted by the prospect of material benefits, which have but little weight with me, but neither could I be forced by any considerations of danger—andyetthemost intrepid of men are affected thereby—to espouse theu· cause, no, not though their services to me were proved to be exceptionally great.
